reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great soap for my skin
reviews.reviewText: My skin became overly sensitive to many products. I decided to give this soap a try and it has been great. I have not had any negative skin reactions to this product. People who want a perfume-like smell to their soap might not like this because of the smokey, pine tar scent. But that scent is not strong after you rinse off. The soap cleans well with no harshness whatsoever. I even take it with me when I travel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Never stop raving about this product.
reviews.reviewText: This product is great for those who battle skin issues all year round. Too oily in the summer, too dry in the winter, and the occasional our body hates us for fall and spring. It moisturizes and cleans very well. One of the few soaps I trust to use on my face. This soap is consistent in its make and application. The smell is amazing but not overbearing. Solid buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My son bought the soap. I have to admit that, at first, I did not care for the odor. It smells like burnt pine tar. It has a strong, outdoorsy smell. It reminds me of camping, so I began to like it. Then I paid attention to the feeling of my skin after using it for a while. I am a convert. Try a bar of it, especially if you like the smell of the "out of doors".

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I personally like the smell of pine "tar" and love the soap.
reviews.reviewText: Good soap, i like the smell. Less "extra" ingredients in this soap. Good for the skin. thanks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: You really do have to have patience with this soap. Other puppps sufferers I’ve noted in reviews have time to bathe 3-4 times a day which I do not. I work normal 8-9 hours a day. Have 2 small kids to take care of. I can get a shower in 1-2 a day. I developed puppps after starting a daily slowfe iron supplement to treat anemia while pregnant at 31 weeks pregnant. The first week started as no more than a few itchy hives on my belly. I had no idea it would turn into 100s of hives within a week. Once I was already at the point of being overcome with hives, I bought this stuff as well as set Dr. Appointments. In a time, where monkeypox is regularly mentioned in the news, seeing that many hives is scary.To the point, the soap does smell like a campfire, the first 4 days it made my skin burn. I had a lot of open sores from scratching and rubbing the hives. By day 4 I was ready to give the soap up because other reviews were saying their puppps were COMPLETELY RESOLVED. And mine were and still very much as at the time of this post - still there. This is an unrealistic expectation. The soap does NOT resolve puppps. It does not cure puppps. You will still have puppps until the baby is born! However, it DOES cleanse the skin in a way that encourages the hives to dry up and scabs to crust over. The skin will start to peel on each and every individual hive. THEY WILL STILL ITCH. The scars from those hives will also remain. Applying this soap, is still rubbing your inflamed, irritated skin. It will also spread the hives while cleansing the skin. I’ve noticed the places on my back where I can’t reach - those hives are still hives in individual places where places I have scrubbed with the soap - there doesn’t appear to be any spaces anymore of skin that’s not affected. Majority of my hives have lost their swollen “raised” look. The scars are still very much there and unsightly. I still itch like no other. To combat itching. I coat my skin in 100% virgin coconut oil several times a day as necessary as I need to whenever I feel the itching coming back. This is the only remedy I have found for itching after trying several others specifically for itching. The soap has not resolved itching for me. Only cleaning, drying up the hives, and helping the skin peel the scabs. I’m 33 weeks now. Still a long road to birth in terms of itching for another month or 2. I hope this helps someone not have such a hard time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Smells wonderful, feels amazing
reviews.reviewText: This stuff smells like fall. Imagine a campfire, surrounded by friends, in your most cozy flannel, wearing the most comfortable pair of soft jeans and worn in boots, sipping coffee as you watch the flames dance and simmer in oranges and golds.... that's the smell of this soap. Comforting, warm, and crisp. It feels like a kiss on the forehead after a particularly hard day at work, or how your heart might react to seeing a truly feel-good story when it was just what you needed. This soap performs absolute miracles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Life Changing Soap. I now only own flannel shirts.
reviews.reviewText: Imagine you are walking through the woods and you are surrounded by pines, tall and majestic. You decide to warm yourself with a fire. The odor that surrounds you is packaged into this bar of soap!With that little fantasy in mind, imagine you are unwrapping your first box of Grandpa Soap Pine Tar and taking your first whiff. The experience is beard growing. The soap has a very strong scent and it will instantly increase your masculinity. If you are imagining something like pine scent, this isn't it. It will likely remind you more of a Clint Eastwood western.My wife is weakened in the knees when I step out of the shower smelling of trees and campfire.The soap itself is quality unsurpassed, and the scent doesn't linger on you when you rinse off. I also find it's effective for dry or irritated skin, and any other skin. I believe it helps with acne and really does amazing job of removing oils and dirt from your body. Grandpa's soap may cause some side effects like a strong desire to buy flannel or chop down a tree.. Other than that, well,it's soap. Pretty good soap at that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have super dry skin and had been using a moisturizing body wash that did not help…Found a little sample bar and a 4.25 oz bar that I must have bought years ago and gave it a go, my skin LOVES IT, no more flakey dry skin, the smell was there but faint and it was gone from skin after showering (no lingering smell on your skin).Boy, new bars arrived and they are strong! So, I removed from plastic, they are airing outside to mellow. The smell is a woodsy mixed with campfire or wood stove but again the smell does not stay with you and the tradeoff for my skin is 100% well worth it and yes, I even use on my face. Though I would prefer unscented, this is the best 😊

reviews.reviewTitle: Campfires, divorce, and painfully swollen armpits
reviews.reviewText: This soap gave me these swollen bumps in my armpits that I don't recall getting previously. I haven't gotten them since I stopped using the soap either. Not good. My wife absolutely hated the smell, I reminded her of the soap just now and she threatened divorce, "I'll take the kid and run". On a sidenote I do enjoy smelling a campfire...but the novelty wears off pretty quick

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: Great if you’ve got a beard and it itches
reviews.reviewText: I got turned onto grandpas soap a few years back when I got an itchy beard it’s awesome stuff to really clean your face 👍
The title description says 6 pack, only got one. Total ripe off!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 11, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Best soap ever for eczema! truly works and has helped me a lot....will order more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 2, 2019
reviews.reviewText: First time using this natural product under recommendation with excellent result
